ooo_row.column_2: value
So tired... oh sorry! What may I help you with?

A Iocal mage keeps demanding more Cold Stones to make Ice Sigils. It’s such a pain to get blue sand from the Chersonese each time she comes around. Can you craft me a Cold Stone? To get the hag off my back?
It’s pretty simple to make a Cold Stone. Put a Mana Stone and some Blue Sand into an alchemy set and let it run. I’ll pay you real well if you bring me one!
Ahhh, thank you. Another week or so without that woman bothering me about these. Here, your reward.
This Forge Golem will stay a heap of junk until I find a way to fix it. Not easy to compete with the old master-artisans.
I’ll craft you armor from the Copal or Petrified Wood you bring me. Want some?
Helmet (2 Copal, 100 silver)
Armor (5 Copal, 200 silver)
Boots (2 Copal, 100 silver)
Helmet (2 Petrified Wood, 150 silver)
Armor (5 Petrified Wood, 250 silver)
Boots (2 Petrified Wood, 140 silver)
Copal Armor set.
Petrified Wood Armor set.
I’ve heard a Royal Manticore has made its lair in the region. Regular Manticores are terrifying enough!
Fresh fruits and meat! Grown right here inside the city!
The Manticores in this region have been breeding more than usual this year. Gabriella and her hunters can’t keep their numbers in check anymore!
If you think you can handle it, I’ll pay you a serious bounty for a Manticore's tail. Just don’t go picking a fight you can’t win, alright?
Everything is for sale, EVERYTHING! Even my mother... but no discounts on her!
If you ever pass through Monsoon, could you take this ledger to Lyda’s general store?
You’re the new member of the Aberdeen Family, right? The Sullivans have been kind enough to open up one of their old homes for your purchase.
Nice day, right?
So, interested in this house?
For a mere 500 silver coin, this house is yours!
Have a good day.
Very well. If you change your mind, you know where to find me.
That’s not enough coin. Come back later, with the money this time!
Welcome to your new home, my friend.
Don’t just stand there, dear! Come in and give those weary feet a rest!
Welcome to my inn! What can I do for you?
Travel safely!
You’ve already rented a room for the day! Go ahead and use it.
Of course! Renting a bed costs 25 silver.
See you soon!
Sorry, you don't have enough silver to stay here. Come back when you can afford it!
Your room is up the stairs, look for the open door. Sleep well!
I have items useful for hunters... whether you hunt beasts or men.
I came here to harvest Beast Golem Scraps. They’re very useful crafting components, but one of the golems injured my knee. So I’ll pay well if you bring me some Scraps.
Then, bring me 2 Beast Golem Scraps and I’ll reward you greatly.
This forest gifts us with the finest leather in all Aurai.
We protect the ancestral city of Berg. Is something troubling you?
It’s just along the main road. Look for the sign with the moon and star.

The smith is next to the entrance on a raised stone platform, and the other traders are down the main street. The hunter trainer is near the main entrance, and the rune sage studies near the Blue Chamber.
The Chamberlords of the many tribes of the Blue Chamber Collective come here regularly to discuss important business. The Blue Chamber itself is that massive building up on top of the hill.
The region has a tame climate and is home to Manticores and Beast Golems. Stay away from the old temple on the mountain, it’s crawling with horrors.
So long as you can pay for my medicine, I’ll see to it that you get what you need.
Hmm, I’m running a little low on Crystal Powder to brew advanced potions. If you’ve got an alchemy set of your own, make some for me, would you?
Ah, excellent! Here, your reward!
You know how to make Crystal Powder, right? Blend 4 Mana Stones in a deployed Alchemy Kit.
You don’t have what I need.
Thank you so much! Here, for your effort.
Good work. Here’s your well-earned reward! Remember, never go out in winter without proper attire!
Hello there [PlayerName]. Need some gear? I recommend our iron weapons and a bow, or a shield if you’re using a one-handed weapon.
Talk about what?
Certainly, lets do business!
Take good care of your equipment, friend. When wits fail you, your gear is all you can rely on out there.
Helmet (3 Blue Sand, 250 silver)
Armor (5 Blue Sand, 400 silver)
Boots (2 Blue Sand, 200 silver)
I can craft special armor from the Blue Sand you bring me. Want some?
Cierzo’s my favourite town in Aurai. The delicious fish, the sea breeze! But, back to business.
The freshest fish here! Caught just moments ago! Take a look!
I always loved the ceviche your parents made. I was never able to achieve the same taste! Could you prepare me a Cierzo Ceviche like your parents used to? I’ll return the favor!
You can gather all the ingredients on the beach in the Chersonese. You remember how it goes, right? A rainbow trout, sea weed and some salt in a great big pot?
The sea was generous today! Seafood and fish, all year round!
Business is slow for me whenever that Soroborean caravan comes in. Let me know if anything I have catches your eye!
Perfect, I was waiting for this. Here, your pay for a delivery well done.
Be sure to come back sometime, these deliveries are needed pretty regularly.
Are you planning to pass by Berg sometime soon? I have this ledger I need delivered to the Pleel’s general store. You'll be paid, of course, on delivery.
Excellent, thank you. Sharing information is essential for merchants like us. You’ll get your reward once you’ve delivered the ledger.
Where can I get some sleep?
Where can I find merchants and trainers?
Who’s important in this city?
Tell me about the surrounding region.
Hey, nice seeing you, [PlayerName]. The Cierzo militia can answer any questions you have.
The inn is the first building South of the gate. The entrance faces the city wall. Also, if you want clean water, go to the Water Purifier to the north-east of the beach.
Merchants are mostly clustered around the Fish Statue in the middle of the city. Our training area is on top of the raised docks, I’m sure you’ll find someone there with the time to mentor you.

The Chamberlady, Rissa Aberdeen is usually in her manor on top of the hill when she’s staying in Cierzo. Burac, the gate warden, is by the front gate. Oh, and Helen Turnbull is looking for curious objects, see her up on the raised deck near the inn.

If you want specifics, ask Burac, our gate warden. Generally speaking, winter can get unbearably cold, so wear thick clothing and keep torches and campfires on hand. And if you’re interested in magic, there’s a Ley Line under the Conflux Mountain, that large purple one in the middle of the region.
Well, if it isn’t [PlayerName]! Come on in! Having the usual?
Our supplies come from the four corners of Aurai. See anything you fancy?
It’s sad to see the old quarry full of bandits. I’m sure there are still some sand roses buried in those mines...
I can craft equipment from Hackmanite or Tsar Stones you bring me. What do you want?
Tenebrous Armor set
Tsar Armor set
Helmet (2 Hackmanite gems, 100 silver)
Armor (5 Hackmanite gems, 200 silver)
Boots (2 Hackmanite gems, 100 silver)
Helmet (3 Tsar Stones, 500 silver)
Armor (6 Tsar Stones, 1000 silver)
Boots (2 Tsar Stones, 300 silver)
Hey I recognize you! It’s a long way from Cierzo, isn’t it? What desires can I satisfy for you today?
I know exactly what you should wear, dear!
Shush. I have goods you won’t find anywhere else, but keep it on the down-low. The walls have ears and the guards have spears.
I was supposed to meet a trader today. He must’ve gotten lost in the desert! Could you find and rescue him with a Travel Ration?
Thank you, I’ll reward you for your service. Just remember to hurry, before he ends up as a dried corpse.
No word from them yet. They’re probably somewhere in Abrassar Desert.
Come back to me in a couple days, another shipment should come.
By now I think it’s too late. Oh well, another shipment should come in a couple days.
I owe you my life, friend. I’ll get these supplies to town and tell the big boss to reward you!
(This merchant is dead. You’re too late to do anything for him.)
F... food... Bandits stole my rations... Help.
(Give a travel ration.)
Arrg...
Innovative weapons and tools are my life! Whether for plowing or killing, my gear’s the best.
Everything is fresh! Come see our selection of daily produce and exclusive ingredients!
You look like the kind of person who would like some coins and doesn’t much care how you get them. Am I right?
I have a client who wants shark cartilage. Keep your mouth shut in front of the guards about it! They don’t like when we trade that stuff!
I heard the food store stocks contraband, the scumbag! Take your time to browse, only legit goods here!
I need this ledger delivered to the Doran’s general store in Cierzo. If you can make the journey, he’ll pay you well for it. Interested?
Welcome to the home of the, er, former baron! It’s up for sale, if you can afford it!
Ah, you’re [PlayerName], right? Her Majesty informed me that she’s granted you the house as a reward for your work. Here’s your key. Enjoy your new home!
Come in. Have a drink! Put your feet up and enjoy the endless festivities of the Heroic Kingdom!
Welcome to the Heroic Kingdom of Levant, home to all those who seek to become legend! What do you need?
The inn is close to the western entrance of the city. It’s the rounded building to either side of the star-plaza, with the lady and coralhorn deer statues.

Most merchants are in the middle of the city, the smith is south of the palace. The trainer is at the palace entrance, surrounded by training dummies and weapons. I’ve also heard that a thief is training people in the Slums...
The king and queen are in their palace to the east of the city. Just steer clear of the Slums to the city’s south. There’s a gate between us and them for a reason!

The heat’s merciless. Wear Desert Armor or take a Ice-Flame Torch with you. Stock up on water at a fountain before leaving the city. Ah, and use the open terrain to your advantage. You can spot trouble way in advance out here.
The rarest ingredients have never been so easy to obtain! See for yourself!
Weapons and armors are made by the strongest, for the strongest!
Need something else?
Browse shop.
Craft me something.
I can craft you armor parts from the palladium you bring me. What do you want?
Helmet (2 Palladium scrap, 300 silver)
Armor (5 Palladium scrap, 500 silver)
Boots (2 Palladium scrap, 250 silver)
Are you sure?
Come back to me later.
You don’t have the parts or funds I need to craft that armor piece.
I’m not done crafting your armor. Come back later!
There you go!
I always enjoy my visits to Monsoon! A true oasis inside a toxic marsh... Need anything to handle the danger outside?
I suggest our local Marshmelons! Picked fresh every day!
The best prices in Monsoon! Hurry up before its all gone!
Suul’s general store in Levant is in need of this ledger. If you’re passing by, could you deliver it? There’s some silver for you if you do!
If you’ve got the coin, you’ll find no greater comfort in this marsh than my inn. Pull up a seat!
In search of a new home? Look no more, this one is a bargain!
This is Monsoon, the divine city under Elatt’s protection. Need information, traveller?
Turn south when you reach the small blue auditorium, and walk up the hill. Keep your eye on the signs, eh?
Most of our shops are up on the roof of the central road here. Use the doors to get to the second floor. The training district is on the large platform just south of the temple.
The lotus temple is the place to go to find the Cardinal of the Holy Mission. Chamberlord Lockwell is across the bridge west of the temple.

Stay out of the marsh water, it’ll poison you. Carrying Marsh Antidotes out here is a smart move. Also, be wary of the Ash Giant village in the north-east, and around the Lich’s Spire in the south-west.
Yes.
No.
No, thanks.
I’d like to talk.
I want to buy something.
Nothing.
Deal, here’s your money.
I want a room, please.
I’m leaving.
Not now.
Farewell.
I'm fine, thank you.
I want to train with you.
(There is nothing I can do with that right now.)
I won’t need your help for a few days, but be sure to come again when I’ll have work for you.
I’m here to collect my armor piece.
(There is a book here.)
(There is a note lying here.)
(Read it.)
(Leave it.)
I am sorry, [PlayerName], but this isn’t your home anymore. The town guards are using it as a barracks at the moment.
That said, we really don’t need to. We have more than enough room in the original barracks. I’ll tell you what, you donate 300 silver, and we’ll let you have your home back.
Hah, I told the guys you ain’t a deadbeat! Alright, here’s the key to your home. Enjoy. We tried to leave as much of it untouched as we could.
Well, your call. If you’re looking for a place to spend the night, the inn is still open for you.
Well, fancy running into you out here! What can I do for you?
[PlayerName]! A courier came by looking for you. Rissa wants to speak to you in Berg next time you pass by!
Ah, [PlayerName]! A missionary just dropped in. He said someone’s looking for you out in Monsoon next time you’re in the area.
Hey! [PlayerName]! A courier just sent word. Someone’s asking for you all the way out in Levant, and hopes to see you next time you’re there. You really get around, don’t you?
Greetings, [PlayerName] Aberdeen! Rissa Aberdeen is looking for you! She should be by the old tomb in the city square!
Are you [PlayerName]? A missionary from Monsoon just came by. She said someone’s asking for you back home next time you’re in the area.
You’re [PlayerName], right? Someone sent a courier from Levant for you. Apparently someone’s looking for you back home the next time you’re in Abrassar!
[PlayerName] Aberdeen? A courier just got here from Berg. Someone’s looking for you there. Next time you’re in Enmerkar, let them know you’re alright.
Ah, [PlayerName]! Ellinara out in front of the temple was asking for you. She says she has work for you!
[PlayerName]! There you are! Cardinal Bourlamaque in the Temple was looking for you. He said it was important!
Hold there a minute! Are you [PlayerName]? A courier from Levant came looking for you. Next time you’re in Abrassar desert, be sure to look into it!
You’re [PlayerName], right? Word just came from Berg, someone’s looking for you. Check in on them next time you’re there, eh?
Ah, [PlayerName], from the Holy Mission! Monsoon sent word for you. Next time you’re in the Hallowed Marsh, you should check in with them!
[PlayerName]! Cyrene said to pass word along that she’s got work for mercenaries like yourself! If you’re looking for coin, you should ask her what she has planned!
[PlayerName]! There you are! The King and Queen summon you for an audience! It seems like they have a serious request for you!
Take care, traveller. It’s not safe out there.
Greetings. I hope you’re well!
I’m afraid I’m quite busy, perhaps some other time.
As a reward for your service, I’ll sell you exclusive goods made by my master. Naturally, these transactions will remain strictly between us.
value
You want to learn how to hunt? I’ll teach you how to be a predator.
Runic magic is versatile and intricate, letting you summon weapons, place arcane traps on the ground and far more.
Amba, my friend! Ready to continue your training?
A visitor! The Cabal shares its wisdom with those who respect the Five Winds. Reason, Passion, Fury, Kindness and the Inside Wind.
To use the spells I teach, find the Wind Totems in every region. Then, you may use these spells in that region. The totems are topped by a bird statue, you’ll recognize them.
Being a mercenary means hardship, from fighting monsters to wearing damn full plate in the desert. It also means freedom and profit!
Empty your mind, be formless, like shadow. Shadow can take any form and overcome any army. Be smart, be shadow, my friend.
I assume you wish to learn magic from me... You don’t look like the type that’s interested in actual philosophy.
Patience and fearlessness allows you to win against any enemy, but honed techniques help too.
I’m calling in a Tribal Favor. Teach me, please.
Hey there. Watch yourself in the swamp. Drop your guard and you’ll see what the inside of a Tuanosaur’s stomach looks like.
I can teach you the Moon Swipe. It’s a sweeping technique for Polearms that deals with enemies attacking from all sides. It’ll cost 50 silver. Interested?
Excellent. Let’s step outside and I’ll show you. Use your shoulder to generate most of the momentum-
And that's how you do it. Here's hoping it saves your life out there!
Ever been to the Jade Quarry in the Marsh’s south? It’s overrun by vermin now that the jade is gone. There might still be something else of value there, though.
If you want a simple spell, I can teach you the Flamethrower spell for the price of 50 silvers. You only need to hold a lantern or a torch, and you’ll be ready to use it.
Smart choice. Rather than using Spark to detonate the air, try “pushing” the air inside your lantern. It will unleash a torrent of flames on any who dare cross you.

Ah, you can tell I’m a dabbler in the magic arts? I can teach you how to give yourself a Boon of Warmth. It gives you resistance to flames and heat, while increasing the damage your own flames do. Does 50 Silver sound fair?
Alright, to start with, try gathering the heat around you by reaching out with your-
And with that, you'll have a Boon of Warmth. It's very helpful while exploring the desert during daylight.

I can teach you to gain mastery over the cold. A Boon of Cool will allow you to resist the cold and frost, and increase the power of your own ice magic. I’ll teach you for 50 silver, so we can bring in something to eat that’s not damn Turmmips!
Yes! I can already taste the Luxe Lichette! So, to cast the Boon of Cool, you pull in any source of cold around you-
And that's how you generate the Boon. It may be helpful to ward off the winter cold, but it's no substitute for warm clothes and a campfire.
For 50 silver, I can teach you a spell to summon a Boon of Blessing. It will protect you from the light and lightning magic from your opponents, and increase the power of your own. Interested?
Alright, sit down. First, we must consider the relation that light and lightning have with one another and-
Hey, now! Don't fall asleep on me! Well, at any rate, I think you've gotten the hang of the Bless Boon. Now, I finally have to money to buy that new alchemy set!
What could I teach a human... Ah, I know. I can teach you a way to become resistant to Decay magic and poisons, and make your own far more powerful. I call it the Possession Boon.
Teach it to me, please.
Sit and close your eyes. I will help you unlock the power to manipulate the Corruption that lurks within you.
-There. The queasiness will fade shortly. ... Ugh, that took a lot out of me... I hope you find the Possession Boon spell useful, human.
Then is there something else that you need?

I do know of an interesting spell that I could pass down. It’s quite helpful in this ghost-filled region. The Mist Boon. It will protect you from ghostly or ethereal attacks, and make your own ethereal damage more powerful. How does 50 silvers sound?
Deal. Let’s get started. First, we need to understand the nature of ghosts as a whole. They are-
Yes, exactly, you've got it! With the Mist Boon, you will be more protected from ghosts, and if you have something like Spiritual Varnish coated on your weapon, you will destroy ghosts with ease.
Yes, I can teach you a little Kazite trick. I can teach you a way to use a one-handed axe to cripple and slow your enemies! Is 50 silvers a fair price?
It’s very simple. Everyone keeps their defenses up to protect their vulnerable head. Take advantage of this and aim low. You’d be surprised at how nasty a wound to the ankle can be!
Amba, friend [PlayerName]! I continue to train every day so that someday I can fill Eto’s boots and protect Cierzo! Maybe we should train together, eh?

I made a trip to visit the old Hermit in the valley beyond the Ghost Pass. It’s a dangerous journey, but his knowledge of magic is vast. To learn the spells of the Cabal of Winds, there is no better teacher.
It’s gonna run you 50 silvers, but I can teach you a technique. It’s a short strike with a lethal twist that inflicts a lasting pain on the victim. Real useful to shank someone who owes you money.
Ok, then, put ‘em up, and I’ll show you how it’s done!
Perfect. The key is to jam your sword up and under their armor if you can. Use one sharp jab and then twist hard!
I’ll teach you a Mace Infusion technique for 50 silvers. It negates an enemy’s elemental attack and imbues your mace with it. It doesn’t even require Mana to use!
This may take some explaining. Mana is a “flow”, so you must carefully catch the spell by-
And that's how you use an opponent's elements against them!

If you pay me, sure, I’ll give you a private lesson. You wanna know the most effective way to finish off a opponent with a 2-handed axe once you’ve got them on the floor? Pay my tab for tonight, it’s 50 silver, and I’ll teach you.
Alright, come with me. We’re going to go practice this on a couple of old logs. Here, I’ll even let you use my axe!
Hah, there you go, you’ve gotten the hang of it! Remember, while you turn for extra momentum, you should step forward and put your full weight into it!
Of course. If you’d like a defensive technique with a 2-handed sword, I’d teach you the Pommel Counter. It’ll leave your foes confused. That lesson costs 50 Silver.
Hold the blade horizontally. Strike back with the flat of the blade. Then bash them with the pommel before they can react!
If you favor two-handed maces, you may learn the slow but powerful Juggernaut Strike. I can teach you, provided you donate 50 silvers to our temple.
Alright, first take a firm stance, plant your feet and pull your mace back. Then once all your weight is on your back foot swing all that weight into a single upwards motion. Here, let me show you...
Gah! Good hit! You've got a good handle on that skill now! Remember, it takes time to pull off. Be sure your blow will connect before you use it!
You want to learn from the king? Buy me a couple rounds at the inn, say about 50 silvers worth, and I’ll teach you my ultimate technique: Simeon's Gambit.
Step outside and I’ll show you. First, you begin by baiting your foe with a low stance and prepare to counter it with a-
And if they don’t fall for it, jab really quick at their shoulder height. You have no idea how often that catches people by surprise!
What is it you wish to talk about?
Can you teach me the basics of rune combination?

Runes are a highly flexible form of magic, and experimentation will be necessary. For beginners, a Lexicon is required to be held in the caster’s off-hand, as each rune has a multitude of meanings depending on their context.

Runes typically linger upon the caster after they're invoked. In order to create a tangible effect, one must cast a combination of runes in a set order. If a combination isn't valid, nothing will happen.

A simple spell is the Runic Blade, which forms a sword of pure mana that is naturally imbued with the Ethereal power. First, you must cast the Shim Rune, followed by the Egoth rune. Dropping the weapon will cause it to return to nothingness.

For those who are part of a prominent family that has earned my trust, like the Aberdeens and the Sutherlands, I can offer to teach you how to Internalize the Lexicon so that you no longer need one to cast rune spells.
Can you teach me how to do advanced rune combinations?

Very well, now that you understand the fundamentals of Advanced Runes, I can teach you how to put them into practice. Some rune combinations are effective only after another rune combination has been activated.

For example, once you have cast a Runic Trap spell and it lies ready on the floor, perform “Shim”, then “Shim” again to create a Runic Blast that will detonate around you. Nearby foes will be harmed, but you won't!

It’s a useful spell if your enemy evades your trap and is bearing down on you. Very few foes expect such a trick from a mage. Many more combinations like this exist with other Runic spells, and only through thoughtful experimentation can one reveal them.

I would if I could, but to actually perform an advanced rune spell, you will need to learn the fundamental theory of advanced runes. Once I have taught them to you, ask me again and I can teach you one of those combinations.
I’m having trouble understanding how to make combinations. Is there a shortcut you can teach me?

Ahh...It goes against my every teaching, but I suppose I can teach you one dirty little trick, on one of two conditions. I crave Diadème de Gibier. It’s been years since I’ve had a bite of that exquisite desert dish...
Bring me some Diadème de Gibier and I’ll teach you that little trick. Or, I suppose if the Collective owes you a Tribal Favor, I can make an exception to my rules and teach you.
Listen well, then. Mages came to the conclusion that each of the four runes are spells that are only useful when building runic combinations.

While crude and incorrect in some edge cases, it is a valid approach. These broad categories by rune are: Dez meaning “Defense”, Shim meaning “Offense”, Egoth standing for “Self” and Fal meaning “Hidden”.
Never forget that the order in which you cast these runes is important. You may find the proper combination of runes, but fail to cast a spell because you cast the runes in the wrong order.
Ahhh, Diadème de Gibier! It’s been so incredibly long! Alright, you’ve twisted my arm.
Very well, for the sake of our Tribes, I will teach you.
I have some Diadème de Gibier for you. Teach me that trick!
value

North-East: Hallowed Marsh
East: Vigil Tower

South-West: Vendavel Fortress
North-West: Cierzo Village
South-East: Conflux Mountain
East: Montcalm Bandit Camp
Danger! Going forward will strand you in the wilderness until you make your way back to the village.
Wind of Reason, grant us the wisdom to know our foe.
Wind of Passion, grow our strength to defeat our foe.
Wind of Fury, strike our foe and be a Scourge upon him.
Wind of Kindness, forgive us and grant our foe swift release.
Inside Wind, turn against our foe and bring balance back to mankind.

West: Berg City
North: Hallowed Marsh

North: Berg City
North-East: Hallowed Marsh

North-West: Berg City
South-West: Vigil Tower
Here rest the spirit of the ancients. Go forth with respect and good intentions.

North-East: Monsoon City
South-East: Jade Quarry

North: Monsoon City
East: Enmerkar Forest

North-West: Monsoon City
South-East: Enmerkar Forest
(This hole seems quite deep.)
(I could jump down.)
(I should stand back.)

Welcome to Outward’s tutorial. Follow the red line to learn about the game’s mechanics.
You can bypass parts of the tutorial by not following the red line.

Press [InputAction_LockToggle] to lock your camera on an enemy, allowing you to hit him more easily.
Press [InputAction_LockToggle] again to remove the lock.
Head down to learn about basic combat.

Perform attacks with [InputAction_Attack1] and special attacks with [InputAction_Attack2].
The number of attacks you make before making a special attack will change which strike you will make.

Evade attacks by dodging with [InputAction_Dodge], though this consumes a fair amount of Stamina.
You can also move away from attacks by holding [InputAction_Sprint] to Sprint.

Your stability bar is at the bottom of the screen while enemies have it under their health bar.
When one’s stability reaches 50%, he is knocked back; when it reaches 0%, he is knocked down.

To assign skills or items to quickslots, open the menu with [InputAction_ToggleInventory], then select the Quickslot tab and assign them there. [Gamepad_Specific]To use quickslots with a gamepad, press the assigned button while holding [InputAction_QuickSlotToggle1] or [InputAction_QuickSlotToggle2].
Proceed up the stairs to learn about skills.

Most spells require items in your inventory or an effect active on you.
Take some Fire Stones on the table, so you can cast Fire Sigils. Take Astral Potions to replenish your Mana.

First, put the Spark and Fire Sigil skills in your quickslots, and be certain to have Fire Stones in your inventory.
Cast a Fire Sigil then use Spark while standing inside the sigil.

Assign the Enrage and Predator Leap skills to your quickslots.
Use Enrage to gain the Rage boon and only then you can use Predator Leap, since the leap requires having Rage active on you.

Status effects are displayed at the bottom left of the screen.
Removing negative effects is important between battles. For example, Bleeding deals damage over time, and is healed with Bandages.
Proceed to learn about Food and Drink, which are two of the character’s needs.

Appease your thirst and hunger, or you will pass out.
Animals and plants provide food, while bodies of water can quench your thirst, though you will need a waterskin to carry water with you.

Cook your meat and boil your water so as not to become ill.
It takes a long time to recover from illness, though medicinal teas can help.

To cook in the wild, you must craft Campfire Kits.
Gather 3 Wood from the nearby tree, enter your menu with [InputAction_ToggleInventory], go to the Crafting tab and select a Campfire Kit.

Once you have a Campfire Kit, go to your Inventory and use it. You can then deploy the Campfire on the ground.
If you have a Flint and Steel in your Inventory, interact with the Campfire to light it.

Cooking with a single ingredient only requires a lit campfire. Recipes with multiple ingredients require a Kitchen or a Cooking Pot deployed on a fire.
You can use a Cooking Pot in your inventory and place it on a Campfire.
Proceed down to learn about managing your temperature in extreme climates.

In hot climates, drink water and wear clothing tailored to protect against the sun.
Heavy armors rarely protect against the heat, though.

In cold climates, campfires and torches can warm you up.
Padded or fur-lined clothes also protect against the cold.
Proceed to learn about managing your inventory capacity.

Even with a backpack, you cannot take all the items you will find.
Equipment is quite heavy and even coins have weight.

Equipment breaks during combat, becoming less effective.
Lanterns burn out while they are lit, and can be refilled by using Crafting.
Food rots with time, even when you are resting or travelling to another region.

Backpacks increase your inventory capacity but usually slow down your dodge.
You can drop your backpack with [InputAction_HandleBag] before combat, then pick it back up after the fight has ended.

Lanterns in your backpack, and not in your pouch, are hung from your backpack, freeing your off hand for a shield or a two-handed weapon.
Open and close lanterns with [InputAction_ToggleLights].

Proceed forward to learn about Resting.
Sleep is another of your character’s needs.

Sleeping, either in an inn or in a tent, removes tiredness and restores health.
It also restores maximum health, which is lowered by taking damage, and maximum stamina, which is lowered by performing strenuous actions.

After you’ve finished resting, enemies can ambush you.
Guarding lowers the chance that this occurs. Where you decide to rest also impacts how likely it is you will be attacked.

修理は武器と防具の耐久力を回復します。
Note that only your currently equipped items will be repaired.
Use the door to exit the Tutorial and return to the Main Menu.

Blocking with [InputAction_Block] prevents the damage from a strike and reduces how much you would be knocked back.
Shields consume less stamina when blocking and can block arrows.
Physical skills often require you to wield a specific weapon type or to have a Status Effect active on you, such as the Rage Boon.
Use this elevator to reach the section on negative Status Effects.

Other items can help manage your temperature, such as potions, tents or meals.
You can also seek shelter underground, where the temperature is usually moderate.
value
Sorry, I haven’t heard any news recently. I’ll keep my ears open, though.
I heard that the Chamberlords of the Blue Chamber collective are gathering in Berg for an important Council meeting! People are coming all the way from the Sirocco region for this one!
I heard a bomb exploded in the Blue Chamber, and strange mercenaries took hostages and damaged the archives! I hope those fiends are brought to justice!
Is it true that there was an attempted bomb attack on the Blue Chamber? This is terrible news! I hope they find the ones behind it and make them pay!

Hmmm... Now that I think about it, I’ve heard of a band of people who set up camp somewhere in the burnt forest far to the south in Enmerkar. They must be crazy, that place is crawling with Burning Men!
You’re planning to talk to the Ash Giants? You’re either very brave, or very foolish. The only Giant settlement I know about is the one in the North-East of the Hallowed Marsh.

Roland? He had a drink here not too long ago. He said he was going to the Conflux Mountain via the Blue Chamber’s path, to become a mage. He seemed really nervous too. I think he would appreciate your help. I don’t know if he could handle the rock mantises in there.
Roland Argenson? I’ve never heard of him, certainly never seen him either. Sounds like someone from Enmerkar or the Chersonese, though.
You’re headed to the Cabal of Winds Temple to fight that Green shell horror? You’re out of your mind! That place is crawling with the Scourge! If you have to go, don't pick any needless fights.

I’ve heard tell that the old Cabal of Winds Temple in Enmerkar is still a Scourge lair. Even after the Holy Mission sent a champion to cleanse the place, the Scourge just keep coming back! It’s scary!
I heard you killed the Green shell horror hiding in Enmerkar’s old temple! I’m very impressed. Not just anyone can take down a Scourge Beast that big.
Sagard Battleborn over there just got into a fight with Julius Sutherland! He killed the poor boy! It was awful! Elatt’s name, what was Julius thinking, pulling a knife on the Chamberlord like that?
I can’t believe this war is coming to a close so suddenly! Elatt’s influence is very great indeed... I wonder if these peace talks will work out or not...
Is it true that Monsoon was attacked by the Scourge, and that Calixa is a goddess now? We live in strange times indeed!

I can’t believe that Old Levant is demanding we cede control of Abrassar to them! If it weren’t for Calixa and Simeon, this place would still be the hunting grounds of the Devourer! They should be thanking us on bended knee!

And now it looks like the Blue Chamber will blame us for the attack on Berg! Why don’t they bother to enforce the law in their own lands?! They’ve had that gang of bandits running loose in the burnt forest of Enmerkar for months!
It’s surprising how people in the slums are sometime more aware of what happens in the city than us. I wonder how many of them have their hands in criminal enterprises, to be so well informed.

I hear that bandit activity is on the rise in Abrassar. While I’m not one to cheer on criminals, it feels like justice. Levant’s armies loot and pillage every village they besiege! They’re no better than bandits, if you ask me!

You’re looking for “The Slide”? There’s two entrances, one near those abandoned ships, and another one somewhere further south. I hear the tunnel gets a little narrow...you may need to crawl to get through.
Sorry, but if you want to order a meal, you can only get half a portion. We’re facing a famine with no idea when things will get better. I worry for the slums. They’ve been the hardest hit.

I just saw a Soroborean caravan come in with these giant tanks of water, with entire Marshmelon plants inside! I don’t know how they pulled that off, and I don’t care. The famine is over! Full course meals for everyone!
I hear that Levant has been hit by famine! Hopefully this leads to an end to the war... I hear their armies are pillaging every village they come across just to feed themselves!
What would I do without that Soroborean Caravan coming from Harmattan every few weeks? He always seems to have precisely what I need, no matter how rare or unusual!
The very palace besieged by our own army! This is terrifying! I hope the King and Queen are alright!
We’re going to need a lot more deliveries of wine if all these toasts to our new goddess keep up. It’s an incredible time to be alive, to witness something like this in our own city!

You’re looking for Yzan? “High and dry, where the boats used to be tied” huh? Well, there was an old set of docks up on a cliff where those ships are stranded. Give that a try... it’s in the north of Abrassar.
So I hear you joined the Holy Mission! I expect I’ll be seeing you here quite often, then!
I hear the Montcalm tribe in the Chersonese is trying to control a personal army of ghosts! If they ever send one after you, you should use weapons that deal elemental damage to fend them off!

You need to deal with some corruption in the valley behind the Ghost Pass? Make sure you have lots of supplies and some way to deal with ghosts. Also, stay away from the Montcalm village! They’ll know you’re from Cierzo and kill you!

I made my yearly visit to the Vigil to pay my respects. My grandpa died killing the Scourge beast that’s stuck in that crystal, you know? I’m glad his sacrifice helped protect this town, but I can’t help but feel unsettled every time I’m around that Vigil.

Zephyrien? Yeah, he was here a while ago, looking for some information about a particular bandit group. I told him they sometimes hide out in the Forest Hive to the south. If you’re going after him, be careful. The Hive Lords are no joke in a straight fight.

I can’t believe that Oliele is locked up! At least 6 of my customers witnessed that incident and I can assure you, Richard came at her with a mace! Why Chamberlord Lockwell is making a mountain out of a self-defense case I just do not understand.

You’re looking for Oliele? The girl with the glowing thing going on? She’s a regular here at the inn. She spends a lot of her time in the slums, though, trying to get information from the locals. She’ll probably be there around this time.

There’s been more and more arguments among you Holy Mission types here at the inn. There’s this one group in particular that’s been asking hard questions, and some of the other members are getting very touchy about it. Can’t we all just behave like adults here?

Some of my usual customers have been missing for a while. I know they didn’t go far from town, but I’m worried they haven’t come back yet. I’m hoping this isn’t about their concerns about Elatt... I don’t want another death like Richard’s to happen.

You’re looking for someone who knows the Old Language? Well Mofat’s been around since before my great-grandmother’s time, he might still remember it. And if not, you can always count on that Soroborean caravan trader for weird stuff like this.
Well, this war is going to get wrapped up real quick. If Elatt demands someone lay down their arms, it’s only a matter of time until that happens.

Not that I’m complaining about everything that happened, but there’s still bullet holes and cracked supports in my inn because of that Scourge attack. The war’s over, great, but my inn’s still in shambles!
Oliele’s missing? Hmm... Well, Alemmon does go for walks out in the swamp quite often and if Lockwell is behind this, his house guard may be willing to spill the beans.

How is your attempt to pay off your Blood Price going? You’d better find that silver if you don’t want to lose your home! Oh! That reminds me, Helen Turnbull was around here, she said she was looking to hire someone for a job!
It’s also possible that some survivors of the wreck washed up on a beach further out in the Chersonese. If you could save one of them, I’m sure they’d return the favor.
Life’s going to be really quiet here without Yzan, Oliele and Rissa. They all asked you to come with them, right? Maybe you should take one of them up on their offer. What do you have to lose?

Oh! You look like the one that Rissa Aberdeen said she was planning to adopt into her family! Everyone in Berg is talking about it! New blood in such a prestigious bloodline could really change things in the Blue Chamber Collective!

What brings you to Monsoon, traveller? Are you thinking of joining the Holy Mission of Elatt? They could always use more dedicated people. I’ve been hearing more and more customers doubt in Elatt’s goals... It’s keeping me up at night.

You’re planning to become a Citizen of Levant, aren’t you, traveller? You’ve come at a difficult time. The slums are packed to bursting with new people, and we’re dealing with increasing bandit raids. I fear one more crisis will topple this entire house of cards!
I’m looking to join the Blue Chamber Collective, how do I get there from here?
I’m looking to Join the Holy Mission, how do I get there?
I want to join the Heroic Kingdom of Levant, how to I get there?
First, you need to head to Enmerkar forest. Head east past the Conflux Mountain, and keep watch for the Chersonese’s Vigil crystal. Head south of it and you’ll find the road to the forest.

In Enmerkar, stay on the north side of the lake and head east as you look for the stone walls of Berg, built into the northern mountain walls. But be wary! Manticores often hunt in that forest. They’re the region’s apex predator for good reason.

In Enmerkar, head East and past the stone city of Berg. Once you leave the stone walls and the lake behind, head north past a small stone archway. You’ll find the road to the Hallowed Marsh not much farther from there.
In Enmerkar, head south-east and past the lake. On the far eastern side of the forest, near the vigil, you’ll find the road to Abrassar Desert, the home of Levant.

First, you need to reach the Hallowed Marsh. Head east, past the Conflux Mountain. When you see the Chersonese’s Vigil crystal, make sure you pass north of it. The road to the Marsh is along that way.

When you reach the Hallowed Marsh, follow the Pilgrim Road. It’s what we call that trail of luminous sun-pillars that leads to Monsoon. If you lose the trail somehow, head north, following the giant ray of light above Monsoon, and you’ll get there eventually.

When you reach Abrassar desert, head east and look for the glowing city on top of a great hill, and you’ll have reached Levant. You may want to stop at the Oasis at the entrance of the desert to re-stock on water while you’re at it.

Unfortunately, there is no Pilgrim Road you can follow in the Hallowed Marsh from Enmerkar. You’ll have to manage on your own, following the Light Ray above Monsoon in the north until you reach the city.

Worse still, the Light Mender Lich has gotten very territorial. Getting past his Spire in the south may be very dangerous, unless you bypass it via the old flooded Ziggurat Tunnel. If this sounds too nasty for you, try getting there from the Chersonese.

In Enmerkar, go straight north. If you see the lake, you’re going the wrong way. Just go as north as you can, until you pass under a little stone arch, and then keep going until you reach the Hallowed Marsh.
To leave Abrassar desert, head as west as you can go. There’s an oasis not far from the road out of here where you can resupply your water, and maybe some berries, if you’re lucky.

Getting to Enmerkar Forest is very tricky from here. You’ll need to head east past the Vigil crystal, and then go south as far as you can go. You can try to use the Light Mender’s spire as a landmark, although it’s not perfectly reliable.
If you get to Enmerkar from the Marsh, go south, and then west as soon as you can. Take the first bridge you see, and you should find one of Berg’s gates right in front of you.
If you get to Enmerkar from the Marsh, walk south then east. The city will be just north of the river.
Once you reach Enmerkar, head north and then west, and take a bridge across the lake. Look for a city with stone walls built into the mountainside. That’s Berg, home of the Blue Chamber Collective.

You have evidence of a plot against the Holy Mission? I can think of several people who will want to hear about this! Rissa Aberdeen at the town square, Sagard Battleborn here at the inn, Cyril Turnbull at the Blue Chamber, and Mathias at his home near the inn.
Oh, you’re looking for Jager Sullivan too? He’s usually standing at the door of his house by the West Gate, across from the farm. Look for the man with the face mask.
